sections.heading: title.667.002Definitions.667.003Applicability of chapter 658
sections.text: 667.004Name.667.005Reorganization, merger, or consolidation with a foreign savings bank.667.006Conversion of state or federal mutual savings bank or state or federal mutual association to capital stock savings bank.667.007Supervisory case;

sections.heading: Definitions
sections.text: 667.002 Definitions.—Except to the extent specifically qualified by context, when used in this chapter:

sections.heading: Name
sections.text: 667.004 Name.—The name of every savings bank shall include the words “savings bank.” The use of the words “National,” “Federal,” “United States,” “insured,” or “guaranteed,” separately or in any combination thereof with other words or syllables, is prohibited as part of the corporate name of a savings bank.

sections.heading: of state or federal mutual savings bank or state or federal mutual association to capital stock savings bank.
sections.text: of state or federal mutual savings bank or state or federal mutual association to capital stock savings bank.

sections.heading: case; emergency conversion, reorganization, merger; consolidation; acquisition of assets.
sections.text: case; emergency conversion, reorganization, merger; consolidation; acquisition of assets.

sections.heading: of assets of or control over a savings bank.
sections.text: of assets of or control over a savings bank.

sections.heading: Loans
sections.text: 667.010 Loans.—On an annual average, based on monthly computations, a savings bank shall have invested at least 50 percent of assets, other than liquid assets of a savings bank invested in either real estate loans or interests therein on home property or primarily residential property and not more than 30 percent invested in loans for agricultural, business, corporate, or commercial purposes.

sections.heading: Except to the extent specifically qualified by context, when used in this chapter:(1)“Capital stock” means the aggregate of shares of nonwithdrawable capital issued by a capital stock association, but does not include nonwithdrawable capital represented by capital certificates

sections.text: On an annual average, based on monthly computations, a savings bank shall have invested at least 50 percent of assets, other than liquid assets of a savings bank invested in either real estate loans or interests therein on home property or primarily residential property and not more than 30 percent invested in loans for agricultural, business, corporate, or commercial purposes.History.—s. 15, ch. 97-30.
